comment: 3 exams over the slides but she doesn't provide all the slides on D2L so you attend class. Had a sheet of paper with names and picture and would call on people to read the slide. Group project and presentation, you get to pick your group. Made us present our project idea to the class and would criticized the people presenting IN FRONT OF THE CLASS

She is nice but too much work and effort expected for a beginner marketing class. In person, online, AND lockdown browser tests are over the top and unnecessary. Large group project and paper you work on throughout the semester and she is a harsh grader. If you are hoping to get an easy A with this entry level class think again. Pick someone else.

The worst professor I have had at KSU so far. I have never had issues with a professor until her. She is extremely unclear, unsympathetic, unwilling to listen to her students, etc. I am an A student and one mistake cost me my grade.
I would not wish this professor on my worst enemy. I have been at KSU for years and have NEVER had so many issues with a professor. I wish I never took this professor at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Shin is a cheat code for people who didn't register with the higher rated marketing professors. She is caring, provides good feedback and is engaging with the class, and gives clear guidelines on what is due. She is willing to adapt to student needs, although her tests are a bit more difficult and requires you to go to class (video heavy).

Very nice & definitely cares about her students. Pretty basic KSU class. Smartbooks for hw, but they're only due right before each test. There is a semester group project and presentation. She grades attendance, but only a few times and it's random. Tests are online with lock down browser and webcam. Easily accessible outside of class.

Honestly, the class itself is not that hard. The first half of the semester is based on lectures and quizzes. Two total group projects and presentations. One is a simulation for the second half of the semester. Her grading is subjective and doesn't make a lot of sense. She is very nice, just grading is a little weird.
do not take her, idk why but her rating was 3.1 and for some reason I can't find her any more in here

Professor Shin is very nice and understanding. She explains things fully and really likes to get interaction from the class to ensure student comprehension. She utilizes quizzes in class that you have to be in attendance for so attendance is very important which some students may not like. No tests only quizzes, 2 group projects, 1 group simulation
